definition: one leg over the other (legs crossed)
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
to stick one leg over the other (when sitting)
to stick one leg over the other (when sitting)

sentences.english: I couldn' t even cross my legs without bumping the hat, and that prospect frightened me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我跷起二郎腿，就一定会碰到帽子。

sentences.english: He sighs, and wipes stray bread crumbs from his beard, rising to his cloven feet.
sentences.chinese: 他叹了口气，抹掉沾在胡子上的面包屑，翘起二郎腿。

sentences.english: Second, Rocker his legs or hands crossed on his chest.
sentences.chinese: 二是跷二郎腿或两手交叉于胸前。

sentences.english: Rest your elbows on the arm of the chair and maybe cross your legs.
sentences.chinese: 把你的手肘放在椅把上，还可以跨个二郎腿哦。

sentences.english: Moving a stool and sitting at a table, he enjoyed himself tasting the tea slowly, crossing his legs.
sentences.chinese: 就搬了个凳子坐在桌边跷着二郎腿慢慢品咂起来。

sentences.english: Jenny sat down, crossed her legs, and drew her skirt down over her knees.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮坐下来，跷起二郎腿，把裙子向膝盖下拉了一拉。

sentences.english: So there’s no reason to sit on the sidelines tapping your foot.
sentences.chinese: 你没理由翘着二郎腿坐着观望。

definition: to stick up/to point sth up
to stick one leg over the other (when sitting)
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
see 悠哉悠哉[you1 zai1 you1 zai1]
